intro: Carex continua var. plebeia, commonly known as the common sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are grass-like, narrow, and usually have a bluish-green hue, while its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-parted flowers. Carex continua var. plebeia plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates and birds.
